column2: Input
column3: Prompt
column4:
Rating:
-1: Errors in the generation or in the input
0: Prompt doesn't describe the current step
1: Prompt describes the current step, but some context is missing in the input/output
2: Prompt is a poor description of the current step, and is in accordance with the context
3: Prompt is a good description of the current step, and is in accordance with the context
4: Prompt is a very good description of the current step, and is in accordance with the context
column5:
Note (optional)
A: copy problem
B: step has too many actions
C: good prompt DESPITE step with too many actions
D: prompt has hallucinations

column2:
Step 1: Add flour, fresh yeast, eggs, part of the water, part of the sugar, and salt to a bowl. Mix for approx. 5 min., using a hand mixer with dough hooks. Add the butter little by little while continuing to mix. Keep mixing for approx. 5 – 8 min., or until the dough becomes a shiny ball, adding extra flour, if needed.
Step 2: Dust the dough ball with flour and cover the bowl with a kitchen towel. Leave in a warm place to rise for approx. 2 – 4 hrs., the longer the better as it will develop flavour and the fluffiest texture.
column3: A woman is dusting a dough ball with flour and covering the bowl with a kitchen towel

Add flour mixture and water alternating and carefully stir to combine until a smooth batter forms.
Step 2: Grease a baking pan and transfer the batter into it. Bake at 180°C/355°F for approx. 30 – 35 min. Remove the cake from the oven and let cool down.
column3: A person is baking a cake in an oven at 180°C/355°F

column2:
Step 1: Add flour, fresh yeast, eggs, part of the water, part of the sugar, and salt to a bowl. Mix for approx. 5 min., using a hand mixer with dough hooks. Add the butter little by little while continuing to mix. Keep mixing for approx. 5 – 8 min., or until the dough becomes a shiny ball, adding extra flour, if needed.
Step 2: Dust the dough ball with flour and cover the bowl with a kitchen towel. Leave in a warm place to rise for approx. 2 – 4 hrs., the longer the better as it will develop flavour and the fluffiest texture.
column3: A woman is dusting a dough ball with flour and covering the bowl with a kitchen towel

column3: the woman is preheating a steamer while she makes her custard

column2:
Step 1: the salmon has been seasoned with salt and pepper
Step 2: Place salmon, bell peppers and cherry tomatoes in a glass bakeware (baking dish).
column3: a baking dish with salmon, bell peppers, and cherry tomatoes in it

column2:
Step 1: A person is adding artichokes, garlic, tomatoes, red pepper flakes, wine, olives, rosemary, and oregano to a pan
Step 2: Transfer chicken to a plate, then return pan to stove and simmer sauce over medium-high heat until thickened slightly, approx. 3 min. Stir in butter. Return chicken to pan and season to taste with more lemon juice, salt, and pepper, if desired. Garnish with oregano.
column3: A person is stirring a pan with a wooden spoon and adding butter to the pan

column2:
Step 1: Answer |  | A person is adding cooked eggs and onion-mushroom mixture to a bowl, seasoning it with salt and stirring it to combine
Step 2: Add sandwich bread to a small bowl and let it soak in the milk. Add ground beef, ground pork, remaining egg, and soaked bread to a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper and mix with your hands to combine.
column3: A person is adding sandwich bread to a small bowl and letting it soak in the milk. They then add ground beef, ground pork, remaining egg, and soaked bread to a large bowl. They season the mixture with salt and pepper and mix it with their hands to combine it all

column2:
Step 1: Wash and quarter tomatoes. Finely chop parsley. Halve avocado, scoop out the avocado flesh, and slice. Add eggs to a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper, then gently beat.
Step 2: Melt butter in a nonstick pan set over medium heat. Add eggs and parsley and gently shake the pan to distribute the egg over the pan. Cook for approx. 3 min. over medium-low heat. Occasionally separate the edges of the omelette from the pan using a silicone spatula.
column3: A person is cooking an omelette in a nonstick pan set over medium heat

column2:
Step 1: A person is cutting up chicken on a wooden cutting board with a knife
Step 2: Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F. Thread chicken, zucchini, and red onion onto wooden skewers. In a large frying pan, heat up olive oil over medium heat and sauté skewers for approx. 2 – 3 min. per side. Then, place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and place in preheated oven at 200°C/390°F and bake for approx. 10 – 12 min.
column3: A person is cooking chicken on a stove top with an olive oil pan. They are using a wooden spoon to stir the chicken in the pan.

column2:
Step 1: A blurry image of a plate with a fork, knife, and spoon on it with the words no photo underneath it
Step 2: Drain potatoes, slice into rounds and put into mixing bowl. Pour over the Vegetable Stock. Allow to cool for 10 minutes.
column3: a person is slicing potatoes into rounds and putting them into a mixing bowl

column2: Step 1: In a medium bowl or on a clean surface, combine All-Purpose Flour into a pile and make a well in the middle, then pour in the Greek Yogurt and Baking Powder.
column3: a bowl of flour and baking powder sits on a table next to a bowl of yogurt

column2:
Step 1: A woman is frying chickpeas in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Step 2: Combine paprika powder, cayenne, coriander, and salt in a mixing bowl. Add fried chickpeas and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
column3: a woman is adding paprika powder, cayenne, coriander, and salt to a bowl of fried chickpeas

column2:
Step 1: the person is holding a piece of dough in their hand that has been folded over
Step 2: Pull the lower corners towards each other.
column3: the person is pulling the lower corners of the dough towards each other

column2:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 180°C/355°F. Add the flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt to a bowl and stir to combine. In a second large bowl beat eggs and sugar until fluffy. Add chili-coconut mayonnaise and stir to combine at low speed. Add flour mixture and water alternating and carefully stir to combine until a smooth batter forms.
Step 2: Grease a baking pan and transfer the batter into it. Bake at 180°C/355°F for approx. 30 – 35 min. Remove the cake from the oven and let cool down.
column3: A person is baking a cake in an oven at 180°C/355°F

column2: Step 1: Preheat oven to 150°C/300°F. Coarsely chop onions. Finely mince garlic. Finely chop rosemary and thyme as well as the parsley.
column3: a person is chopping onions on a cutting board with a knife

column2:
Step 1: Add flour, fresh yeast, eggs, part of the water, part of the sugar, and salt to a bowl. Mix for approx. 5 min., using a hand mixer with dough hooks. Add the butter little by little while continuing to mix. Keep mixing for approx. 5 – 8 min., or until the dough becomes a shiny ball, adding extra flour, if needed.
Step 2: Dust the dough ball with flour and cover the bowl with a kitchen towel. Leave in a warm place to rise for approx. 2 – 4 hrs., the longer the better as it will develop flavour and the fluffiest texture.
column3: A woman is dusting a dough ball with flour and covering the bowl with a kitchen towel

column2: Step 1: Remove stems from kale. Roughly chop or tear leaves with your hands. Transfer to a large mixing bowl along with some of the lemon juice and olive oil. Mix to coat and massage oil into kale to soften. Set aside.
column3: A woman is chopping kale with a knife on a wooden cutting board

column2: Step 1: Finely chop garlic and basil. Roughly cut lobster into bite-sized pieces.
column3: a person is chopping garlic and basil on a cutting board

column2:
Step 1: a salad bowl filled with watercress and avocado sits on a wooden cutting board
Step 2: Pour on the vinaigrette over the watercress and avocado and you’re done! You may save back a bit of the dressing so your guests can drizzle on a bit more if they so desire. Serve alone, or as a side salad like I did.
column3: A salad bowl filled with watercress and avocado sits on a wooden cutting board
